subject: Swimming
lead_paragraph: Peter Marshall of the United States broke his own world record in the 100-meter backstroke on the first day of the short-course World Cup meet in Berlin. Marshall won in 49.64 seconds, three-tenths of a second faster than the record he set Tuesday.
snippet: Peter Marshall of the United States broke his own world record in the 100-meter backstroke on the first day of the short-course World Cup meet in Berlin. Marshall won in 49.64 seconds, three-tenths of a second faster than the record he set Tuesday.
